of the action being the formation of amylamine and 
carbon dioxide:-
C6H13NO2 = N(C5H11)H2 + CO2.
g) By digesting the organ itself with boiling water 
and filtering, the filtrate contained leucin and 
tyrosin.
It may be remarked, <u>en passant <\u>, that neither the 
organ nor its secretion contains biliary acids or 
glycogen.*
<u>The Crop.<\u>
This organ is fully developed in the imago. It does 
not secrete any fluid; in fact it serves simply as 
a food receptacle or reservoir.
*In many different insects (e.g., <u>Periplaneta <\u>) the stomach 
has not a pancreatic function, for this function 
is performed by the pyloric caeca.
